intro: Sibbaldia melinotricha, commonly known as the alpine sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it survive in harsh, cold environments. It typically grows in rocky or alpine soils at high elevations. Sibbaldia melinotricha plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
